thread.title: Texas A&M reels in commitment from four-star big man Mitchell Robinson
thread.title_full: Texas A&M reels in commitment from four-star big man Mitchell Robinson | Dallas Morning News

author: EJ Holland
title: Texas A&M reels in commitment from four-star big man Mitchell Robinson
text:
Kevin Sumlin is flying all over the state on his "Swagcopter."
But Billy Kennedy and the Texas A&M basketball staff are hard at work on the recruiting trail as well. Over the weekend, the Aggies landed a verbal commitment from 2017 Chalmette (La.) big man Mitchell Robinson.
"We just liked the campus, the environment, and the people," his mother, Kesha Hall told CBS Sports. "Mitchell and I both were impressed with the weight training. We both felt very comfortable."
A four-star prospect, Robinson committed to Texas A&M over offers from Alabama, Auburn, Florida State, LSU and others.
The 6-foot-9, 200-pounder is ranked as the No. 4 center in the country and No. 3 overall prospect in the state of Louisiana, according to 247Sports Composite.
Robinson is the first commit in Texas A&M's 2017 class.
